input_text:
Job Title: Structural Fatigue Engineer

Location: Bethesda, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Category: Engineering

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Local

* * *

CACI is seeking a Structural Fatigue Engineer to support the NAVSEA Structures and Composite Division, which focuses on the structural development and testing of surface craft and submarines. This position is based in Bethesda, Maryland. Must currently hold or be able to attain U.S. Government Secret Security Clearance (Minimum). (US Citizenship is required in order to obtain a security clearance from the DoD.)

What You’ll Get To Do

As the Structural Fatigue Engineer, you will be the driving force behind designing laboratory test solutions for structural fatigue and fracture analyses. This includes designing, although not always performing, experiments and determining the best way to collect and analyze experimental data. In this role, you will be working across multiple functional teams where complex problem-solving and communication skills are critical to success.

This opportunity provides a fantastic opportunity to grow your skillset while working to improve the Navy’s operational capabilities.

More About The Role

Develop engineering solutions to fatigue and fracture, and structural strength design and analysis problems.Lead and project manage large scale structural laboratory test efforts.Provide guidance and mentorship to less experienced personnel.Collaborate with senior personnel to develop project proposals and participate in technical knowledge management.Maintain network of contacts both inside and outside the organization for technical collaboration, information, and funding sources.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or related field.M.S. in Mechanical Engineering or related field.5+ years of experience in structural engineering and/or fatigue analysis.Must currently hold or be able to attain U.S. Government Secret Security Clearance (Minimum). (US Citizenship is required in order to obtain a security clearance from the DoD.)Ability to come on-site 2 days a week and/or as needed.Basic understanding of fatigue and fracture mechanics.Experience performing structural laboratory testing.Ability to develop structural laboratory test plans and procedures.Understanding of hydraulic and electronic control systems, data acquisition systems, and instrumentation.Basic experience performing data analysis using laboratory measurements.Ability to communicate technical and programmatic information to various personnel including junior and senior engineers, laboratory technicians, management, sponsors, and customers.Ability to provide direction and instruction to various personnel including junior engineers and laboratory technicians.Ability to follow/understand standards and codes for design.Familiarity with design/fabrication/fatigue & fracture mechanics in different materials (metals, composites, etc.).Knowledge in detail design and fabrication methods.

These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have

Advanced knowledge of fatigue and fracture mechanics.Experience with large-scale laboratory testing programs.Advanced experience developing engineering design guidelines using laboratory measurements.Knowledge in detail design and fabrication methods specifically for ship.

What We Can Offer You

We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

This position is contingent on funding and may not be filled immediately. However, this position is representative of positions within CACI that are consistently available. Individuals who apply may also be considered for other positions at CACI.

Company Overview

CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here

The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is

$66,100 - $135,600

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
